result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

2:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rick G. Roquet appeared by video from Vernon Cty. Jail, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Rick G. Roquet.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court notes 07/28/22 bench warrant; court withdraws warrant at this time.  
     D.A. requests an addtl. $200 bond for a total of $350.00 cash.
     Atty. Erickson states Def. is on a probation hold up there for another month; unable to come up with the $200 bond; requests the current bond continue.  Does not know why Def. failed to appear for July hrg.
     Def. encouraged to reach out to his atty.  Court orders an addtl. $200.00 bond to be posted.
     Def. states he is homeless; has no job; knows no one.  Atty. Erickson will call him.
     Court concludes at 2:11 p.m.
Status hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:25 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Rick G. Roquet not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Rick G. Roquet.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson has no information re: def's whereabouts
Court authorizes a warrant
Atty. Steiner requests warrant with $200.00 additional bond 

Court authorizes warrant with $200.00 bond and be given a new court date

3:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rick G. Roquet appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Rick G. Roquet.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard and ready to proceed with preliminary hearing. 

1W Lt Casey Cox, sworn
Exam by Atty Steiner
Cross by Atty Erickson 

Comments by Atty Steiner. 
State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Erickson waives any argument and objects to any bind over. 

Court puts findings on the record. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
State files information. 

Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each of the two counts.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rick G. Roquet appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Erickson appears on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Rick G. Roquet appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond. State requests a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
